values: so. day one of semester 2. well, technically, it's semester 8. yikes! here's what it looks like: [1] psychology -- decker [2] nutrition/foods 1 -- shane [3] assistantship -- strebig [4] adv. photo -- hopper [5] adv. ceramics -- husar [6] etymology -- fettig [7] band -- barber w00t. anyway, all the bussle of the halls...people exchanging schedules, talking about teachers...there's just a buzz swimming through the school. let's see. what can i say so far? well, the Circus Midget is in my psych class...mr. decker seems cool, and i'm actually not that off-set by the news of an 8-10 page term paper. it's going to be about my life, and all the things that have happened that make me who i am now. guarenteed to only GET into the hands of anyone to be read that I don't PLACE IT IN. not even decker's wife gets to read them. so i can just....let it flow, and feel alright. he says he had to put a cap on it, limiting it to 15 pages....because someone once turned in a 72 page paper. and others used to turn in 20-30 pagers, soooo i can understand him not wanting to make that kind of commitment. YIKES. Foods. yikes. i've got to hand it to you Kelly, you really had me hooked on the idea. you said, yeah, it's not a blow-off, but it's not hard. and you get to make stuff and eat it. THAT MAY BE TRUE. BUT you failed to mention that it was a FRESHMAN/SOPHOMORE class. 10 freshman. 3 sophomores. 1 senior. sweetness. i'll have to get back to you kids about the rest of my classes, but i'm not worried about this assistantship, being that i've had...5? semesters of this already??? dunno, something like that. anyway. photo should be alright, too. i made sure my notebook was NOT black, so my band locker, car, and house will have NO EXCUSE to consume it and make it disappear off the face of the planet. ceramics, i've done before. etymology. must make this priority. it HAS to be a good grade. and i've heard its relatively simple. *raises glass* here's for hoping. love to all, my heart to one.

WHO LIKES COOKIES???? guess who's the resident girl scout? that's right. yours truely. so hit me up a day before you want them so i can solicit things from my Rodeo in the HHS parking lot. unless, of course you're not a student. in which case, you need to start bugging me via cell and arranging pick-up and/or drop off times and places. i think they're $3.50/ box this year.... yeah. price rose last year. suckysucky. but let me know, Thanks.

so i've had two days off school. great.

and i've been yelled at by more people than you'd imagine, for some of the stupidest reasons i can think of.


sweet.



so many times i've wanted to tell one person or another to jump up a rope....

so many people that just make me feel like i'd be doing them a favor by not existing.

so people i wonder if i even exist to in the first place.


throw on top of it all facing potential suspension at work for something i can't help, along with extensive and continual failure to find a new job.


i can't remember the last time i updated, and so much for a decent resuming entry.

so it goes.

is it bad when
                                                                   what's bothering you wants to come out,

                             and the space is there wait to be used,

                                                                                                   but when you go to write, you can't...

 

because you don't want the people you call friends

                                                                          to get involved,

                          when all they'll want to do is lend a hand,

                                                                                                                              an out stretched offer,

to pull you upright again?

 


                                                                                                                                                                                                               lucky for me
                                                                                                                                                                                    this time it's nothing major.
                                                                                                                                                                     and i guess the fact that i
                                                                                                                                                 know people would want to 
                                                                                                                               lend me their ears and hands
                                                                                                            and arms and eyes gives me 
                                                                                          something to take comfort in,
                                                                        but, as Rob Thomas said once,
                                                     it's best if we all keep this
                                 under our heads...and i don't
                 know how to get it back
to good. ---yet another
              of my famous exaggerations.
                                         -just ask one person i
                                                             know all too well, who, 
                                                                             i'm sure, has rolled their
                                                 eyes by now. but everyone's
                               free to think, right?

                                           sorry if i'm thinking a
                                                                    little too hard.

                                                                                     i do that.
                                                                                               and you know you've done it.
                                                                                                                     most all of you, i've 
                                                                                                                                             witnessed.

                                                                                                                                                                * adieu.

ok, so i guess i owe an explanation to a few people out there... since some of you caught me in the worst of my anxious pacing around the house, and looking back now, i was really quite overly-dramatic over something that just kind of took my mind by storm. i got a call from Tom at 445 yesterday morning, and he said that he was sick, and he was having the same kind of cramping i described to him the sunday after thanksgiving when i had food poisoning... so i sympathized and told him to try and get some rest when he could, and that i'd talk to him later. so i went back to sleep and when my alarm went off at 630, i rolled over and head out into the house to do the wake-up and get ready to go thing. as i was driving to school, around 655, i called him and asked how he was doing, and he said worse. so again, i sympathized, but he kind of grumbled at me and said he didn't feel like talking, so i told him i'd check up on him when i could, and of course, to try and get some sleep. i went on with my day of school, with my headache from the chicago trip the day before still lingering. i called dad from my cell during 3rd period and told him i wanted to come home after i survived my english class, and he said whatever. so i did, then i called Tom when i got home, but it sent me straight to his voicemail. so i thought, well, he must have turned his cellphone off so he could get some sleep... so i rolled over and didn't regain consciousness until around 125, when i tried calling again. voicemail, again. so i went back to sleep. finally, i woke up again aroudn 330, and called. still with the voicemail. so i decided to call Josh and ask him how Tom was doing when he came home to change for work. he said Tom was gone when he got there, and he asked if i knew where he was. i told him if i heard anything, i'd call him back. then i called Shawn at home, trying to see if maybe Tom had called her. no answer. just as i was about to call Josh back, Shawn called me from the St. Vincent Hospital in Indy. She and Lyngail were waiting to go in to see Tom. He'd driven himself to the emergency room sometime after i'd talked to him that morning, and they ran some tests on him and discovered he had appendicitis. SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO he had just gotten into the recovery room from surgery. i hung up with Shawn and started digging around for a way to get to Indy. running out of time, but here's the quick ending: mom got off work, we left around 6ish, we got down there and stayed until about 9ish, and came home. Tom comes home tonight, and doesn't come back to Indy til monday. w00t. choir concert tonight. playing the hallelujiah chorus with the choirs. back up band til 5...choir concert at 730. yahoo. love to all, my heart to one...

thursday.... what does thursday mean to me? one more sleep til Tom comes home... hot rolls at lunch... back-up band practice after school til 5... paychecks at work every other week... payday for mom every other week... possibly going out to dinner with the family... and of course, the wrap up of yet another struggle to get from 6am Monday to 2pm Friday. love to all, my heart to one.

wow...today's a STRUGGLE... orchestra was me propping myself up on the chair, slouching and turned sideways, and still barely playing. i was absolutely DRAINED. photo i milled about attempting to get soem contact sheets done, and basically was a zombie. but i got the contacts done, just not done WELL. *sigh* tomorrow's another day, right? this assistantship was about to put me to sleep, too. i had to make 250 copies of a concert flier, and while that only took about 8 minutes, thanks to one minor interuption, i was still dazed and floating off in my own little daydreamy world of inscence and peppermints and fuzzy bunnies. then i had some practice cards to enter, and i managed 2 classes....so i'm drowning slowly in my day. i was rather proud of myself for eating almost all of the noodly stuff i had left from last night, which was a feat in itself this morning. anyway, i'm almost out of time. time to crawl off to novels and hope for limited make up work. love to all, my heart to one.

so i was sick for like...12 hours yesterday, and in rehab pain for another long time.... think i might have gotten food poisoning from the chinese restaurant Tom, Shawn, Sarah, Abby, Joe, and i met Tom's grandparents at in Decatur.... woke up at 4something sunday morning...got sick as shit, kept it up for about 6 hours, with some broken attempts at sleep in between, then leveled off for awhile. Mom and dad left for the family thanksgiving with mom's side, left me home. Tom called, and decided to come over and keep me company. after he got there and we chatted idly for a minute or two, i slept for a little while. i crawled downstairs and got a bottle of propel to try and sip on in the hopes of being through with sick-time. None such luck. i was sick within 10 minutes, and Tom stood at the door of the bathroom, then handed me the wash rag to wipe my face on, even though i know it was all he could do not to start barfing right along side me. Then he laid with me for awhile, and eventually we moved from my parents bed to my bedroom, in the hopes of getting me some sleep, because i couldn't get comfortable on mom and dad's bed. and i started trying some more propel after awhile, but ended up laying on the floor until i was ready to head for the toilet. then we went back to mom and dad's bed, and sat watching tv for a few hours....then i was SO DESPERATELY THIRSTY, we decided to try some bits of ice. worked out nicely. graduated to sipping the water from the ice bowl, and eventually took some kind of stomach medicine that seemed to help me get a little more comfortable. Tom stayed from 11ish in the afternoon and babied me until about 1045 when Josh decided he was ready to head back to Indy. So Tom tucked me in, and brought my dog to my room, and headed off. i ended up not sleeping much, though i was so absolutely exhausted from the day. so i stayed home dead from school today...in an attempted to regain some strength and get some rest. food intake: 2 bottles of water, 2 slices of bread, 2 bites of a steakburger with cheese, some scraps of steak'n'shake fries. attempted noodly stuff i made, but it made my stomach uneasy, so i'm moving back a step to saltines and propel... random comments along that note: Siella: noodly stuff is making my stomach hurt again... Siella: so i'm rockin some crackery type friends now... Dave: haha, they are kind and gentle friends Siella: lets paint a happy little tree. Dave: hahaha Siella: and we'd better give it some friends.... Siella: lots of happy little trees. Siella: saltines and propel. Siella: blarg. Tommy: lol cherry propel... Tommy: eacky Siella: uh, yeah, it is. love to all, my heart to one.

so, school is taking too long....i have to get out of here, so Tara, mom and i can run out to the mall to get something for Tom, which i can't say what, since he reads this semi-regularly...THOUGH HE NEVER SEEMS TO UPDATE HIS TO LET US ALL KNOW HE'S EVEN ALIVE!!! i hope mom'll let me give it to him as a "just 'cuz" present, cuz i don't wanna wait til christmas for this for him...it's nothing major, i guess, but i really just like giving him things :) cuz no matter how abso-corny i think it is, he seems to really appreciate them and they make him smile....cuz he just knows its a typical Lisaism to buy/make/do something goofy but affectionate. go figure. anyway, i'm listening to the 6th graders play a song called "tidings of joy" which is strikingly similar to the christmas song "tidings of comfort and joy", but not quite...so i have the music flowing in the office door, and i'm humming god rest ye weary gentlemen... and then they don't go on to play certain parts, because its BASED on the christmas song, but it's not a rendition of it, so it only has clips and chunks of the actual song in it. joyous. op. now they're playing "the clarinet jive" and it's a song that's got an ending like...."good evening frieeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeends"....wow. these on top of spaz's house destruction party all stuck in my head....CHRIST on an EFFING CRACKER... as for thanksgiving, i've got my weekend cut out for me....have a li'l look-see.... :: THURSDAY :: -lunch w/ dad's side of my family @ Uncle Steve's [Ossian] 1pm. -dinner w/ Tom's direct family @ Kenny/Odessa's [on Broadway] 6 pm [i'm guessing] :: FRIDAY :: -sometime thanksgiving with Tom's mom's family @ Lynngail's LaGrange....dunno what time :: SATURDAY :: -watching Tom and dad take apart Tom's car the rest of the way until its done starting whenever :: SUNDAY :: -lunch/dinner mom's side @ Aunt Kari's....sometime. probably afternoon to early evening. w00t. three cheers for triptophan-induced comas. but hey, good food is good food, and life will just have to go one without me if pass out in a turkey-overdose. mmmmMMmmmmMMMmmMMmmmmMMMMMMmmmmMmmMMMMMmmmMMMmmmMMMmMmmMMmmMmmmmMmMMMMMmmmm.... three sheets to the wind...

"the world is not always just, but when it is, it hurts more than when it is not." i'll go curl up again...my chin and knees have a magnetic attration lately... it wasn't supposed to be like this, but we're sewing the wound shut and perservering.

photo today was definetly uh....productive. i had to make a negative holder with a piece of black paper, make 2 identical prints of the neg one way, flip the neg holder over and print 2 identical prints of the inverted image....and on top of THAT, in the last 5-6 minutes i managed to make 6 prints of the picture of me and Tom, of which only 4 survived being developed and trimmed....since one i accidentally moved the paper holder and so it was half exposed in one spot, and the other half on a different part...woulda been ugly...and the other that didn't make it was killed on the cutting table, because it was too crooked to crop and keep both Tom and i whole. [which is always a good thing, ya know?] anyway. so i have enough copies for me, mom, Tom, and Tara...and still have the one good original print and the one not so good original print. Strebig's out there teaching the 8th graders to play their school song....of course, as my alma mater middle school was summit, though i can't recall what our school song IS, i can't even begin to recognize WOODSIDE's fight song....crazy. wait... i just had a recollection of the end of it... the green and grey...will win today...oh summit we're for you... wow...that hurts me that i actually remember that... anyway....whatever. i'm off to be a dork.

my pretty pictures :) they don't look as good, cuz i took pictures of the prints with dad's digi cam...so this is the best i can do. this is my favorite hand-colored....its a black and white of the flowers that climb out driveway light...irl the flowers are and briliant purple and the pistols are a golden yellow color, so this is what i managed with oil pastels. :) prettiness :) this is black and white, too...though it looks almost duo-toned [sepia (aka brown) toned and blue toned at the same time] but its in the woods in my addition....Tara, Tom and i all went out on tour taking pictures [well, Tommy was basically company and subject matter] and Tara took this of me and Tommy. it's really supposed to be up right with Tom's head on top...i'm sitting between his legs, he's leaning his head on my head laying back....and we're both sitting on bare tree roots. <3 ok, i'm done...promise.... maybe i'll lj cut next time, but these make me smile, so i'm forcing them on you. :P love to all, my heart to one.

ahhh, this weekend...what a trip.... anyway, so we'll back-track to friday, since we all know what was up on Halloween :P friday was the [hopefully] last football game the band'll have to play at [assuming we get squished by Snider, like we always do....especially since they've not lost a game by less than 40 points all season....hmmm, what do YOU think?] Tommy got in town right near the end and we dropped my car off at home since we were going to Stash's for his surprise party. we hung around there for a few, then booked after Stashed opened his presents. we went and grabbed some food, then decided that i should work on my driving of 5-speed vehicles in the church parking lot. so we did. and i did better than i even expected, though i told Tom i'd done it before and just need a brush up, i think he was surprised at how well i did. i got bored and decided we should head home, and it was like....1130 or something. so Tom told me i could just drive home if i wanted to, so i head out onto Aboite Center....and it started shaking...chugging really after i put it in 2nd gear....and Tom goes "baby, you gotta give it some gas..." and i said, "it's to the floor, dear." and he goes...."oh....shit...." so he had me pull over, and then it just stalled out and died. wouldn't start again and didn't appear to have anything wrong...so we rolled it into Plantations of Aboite and called mom and dad. mom towed him home. saturday morning i went over to Tom's about 915ish and crawled in bed with him for a bit, then we parused about, hung around the house, and generally accomplished nothing....we were supposed to go to the maize maze with his family at hilger's, but decided against it. around 5ish, we headed back to Tom's so i could paint his mom's face for her halloween party....yeesh...she was going as a cat, and wanted her face painted in the likeness of "Rumple Teaser" from the broadway show Cats. in itself, this would be a feat....but wait...there's more. she had a black dress, so i had to substitute and kinda make up my own design using white, black and grey instead of orange yellow brown and white...but it turned out good. while Tom was upstairs sleeping [he didn't feel good] i helped Joe make his costume. he was a fat old lady with a "lost dog" sign and a stuffed dog sticking out from between his butt crack. so i helped him ducktape a giant pillow to his waist and fitted him with plastic bag boobs and he really was just....different looking...then he was bending over so i could try to stuff the stuffed dog inbetween his fake buttcheeks, and let me tell you....some lines were crossed that i REALLY could have done without crossing....lol... maybe it's just something about trying [and failing] to jam a stuffed toy up your boyfriend's stepdad's butt....or maybe its just me....lol... sunday Tom and dad found out that a bolt on something that was supposed to be fixed on the integra before Tom picked up the car had come loose, was probably only hand-tightened instead of cynched down with a wrench or whatever....and so the engine was sparking and getting feul, just not sparking at the right time. helpful, no? but at least it got fixed and got fixed without costing anything. then Tom and i did the candy thing, and the costume thing, and we went to see grandma in our goofysuits...and took Tom's sisters the candy bags mom made up for them. we stopped by walmart on the way home, grabbed an in-dash CD player and install kit and junk....put that all together and in, and then we had all of 25 minutes to just lounge about before Josh called and summond Tommy away to go back to Indy... :( never fun....but inevitable. and that was my weekend. :) good stuff over all. "..and that's the way the cookie crumbles..."

HAPPY HALLOWEEN!! i went deep-sea diving in the spare bedroom, and this is what we came out looking like. i'm a lamby :) and Tommy's a bat the lamb costume i'm wearing i last wore when i was 2 and Tom's a bat....Tara wore that when she was 8ish or something.... funness ^.^

well, yesterday's attempted nap time was interupted by some heart wrenching conversations over text....but they finally got solved, though a tear or two had to fall to seal the deal. it's alright now, and it's not really that big of a deal....right? right. in other news, i was sitting here fiddling around on the internet, and decided to check my SAT registration, or rather DOUBLE check it....as i think i'm supposed to take them a week from saturday..... and i've got this sinking feeling, since i saw that it said i had no registrations started, and none completed...this could get bad...but i may have put the wrong user name in, since it took me like, 3 attempts to even succeed in writing down the name and password......genuis, no? anyway, i'm scheduled to leave Woodside any minute, so i guess i should wrap this up...
*NOTE TO SELF*
----apply to GoodWill and Ace Hardware tonight---- my poor feet and knees can't take much more of Flanagan's.....but god i love the people i work with....most every one of them makes my work experience tolerable.....until i get home, take my shoes off and sit down....when it hits me just how much pain i'm in....lol love to all, my heart to one.

home alone. not such a bad thing, right? except i'm not at my "regular" "real" home...i'm at Tom's house. alone. it really is kind of weird how comfortable i am sitting here in this house...waiting on his mom to get back from picking up the girls from school....almost eerie. both Tom and his mom and the rest of his family have testified that there are the spirits of his deceased family members still hanging around within these walls, and i can almost testify, as well...sometimes when i'm sitting in the living room, like last week when Shawn was being "attacked" by some mormon missionary people, i was sitting on the couch with Cloe [Tom's cat] and she refused to sit on my one side, but rather was hiding under my sweatshirt on the other....and the side she wouldn't sit on was eerily chilly, compared to the other side, which felt so warm i wanted to take my sweatshirt off [as one tends to feel when out of the weather and indoors, with central heating, ya know?] so i talked to Tom, and we both came to the conclusion that more than likely, according to the family's beliefs of their relative's ghosts hanging around, someone, probably his grandma, was sitting beside me, and didn't want Cloe in her lap. o.o;; odd.... but so, the three of us, myself, Cloe, and the unnamed other, sat and watched as the mormon's talked Shawn's ear off for more than an hour, then i went to pick up the girls from school. yet another reason Tom says his family, but alive and otherwise, must like me, and like me alot more than Charlotte. Charlotte refused to go anywhere in this house without Tom, because they grabbed at her, and tried to get her to leave. crazy. so i'm happy, comfortable, and welcomed from this house and all its inhabitants. :) yay :) Shawn should be back soon. three sheets to the wind....

so i guess it's only been forever since i updated, and from what i can recall, you could hardly call it an update. so let's buzz past what's gone on since then, and deal with the most recent stuff...as in, within the last weekish. Friday, my cellphone sustained massive water damage, creating a tiny-cellphone-hemorhage, so i got a new one....yes, yes i know i'm a spoiled little brat....5 cell phones in a just under 2.5 years....whatever, my new phone WORKS...and it ROCKS, even if it IS taking more of my money i DON'T HAVE....so i owe mom even MORE money, but that's alright...i'll get to it. Friday night and Saturday, Tara and i hung out, and i spent the rest of the weekend, basically, in Indy hanging with Tom at his apartment with his roomies and friends and what not. Monday on the way home, i stopped in at Ball State and chilled with Tara, watched a movie, then proceeded home, where i reworked my Novels essay on The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe....w00t. Tuesday, school was simple. easy marine bio test. nothing too exciting. anatomy is about to make me tear my hair out...we're doing lab work, and i was partnered up with Ben Deschner. wow. kill me now. its like, hey, Lisa does the lab while Ben messes ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING UP while talking none-stop to Jeff whats-his-face and Ally Matheis.....*growls* Today was alright, middle of the week already, can't hardle believe it...had a quiz over my next novel, My Antonia....worthless book...but still did fine on the quiz. w00t for me. starting the Sea Turtles unit in Marine....EASINESS....i mean, how hard can it been to memorize some stuff about turtles with all i already know from being a nature-freak as a kid? honestly! band was nice today...it was cool, overcast and kinda go-through-the-motions for the tenors...nothing major to work on, just some redundant cleaning. first competitions Saturday. Wayne in the afternoon, then Ben Davis in the evening...and Tara and Tom are BOTH coming to see me at Ben Davis!!!! YAY!!!!!!!!! you should all come to Ben Davis...it'd be FUN! ROADTRIP! take I-69 south to exit 0 and get onto 465 west. take 465 to the west 10th street exit, third light turn right [girl's school road] the school's on the left. the 3rd entrance takes you the to correct parking lot...i think. but i know that's how you get to Ben Davis. 7:15am arrive at Homestead HS 7:30am basics begins 8:00am musical warm-up 8:15am practice show 10:45am run throughs 11:15am end practice 11:16am load equipment, eat lunch at school 12:20pm load buses 12:30pm depart for Wayne HS 1:00pm arrive at Wayne HS 1:20pm change into uniform 1:55pm get instruments 2:05pm movement warm-up 2:25pm line up for transit 2:30pm trasit to warm-up area 2:38pm warm-up in warm-up area 3:02pm transit to performance field 3:12pm staging 3:15pm performance 3:25pm end performance 3:30pm change out of uniform 4:10pm load buses 4:20pm depart Wayne HS for Ben Davis HS 7:00pm arrive at Ben Davis HS 7:20pm change into uniforms 7:50pm get instruments 8:00pm movement warm-up 8:20pm transit to warm-up area 8:30pm warm-up in warm-up area 8:50pm transit to field 9:00pm staging 9:05pm performance 9:45pm awards 10:00pm change out of uniform 10:50pm load buses 11:00pm depart for Homestead HS 1:30am estimated time of arrival at Homestead HS sounds like fun to me, eh? by the looks of it, it's gonna be a LONG. DAY. c'est la vie. that about wraps it up for me... "and that's the way the cookie crumbles..."

today moved smartly along...not exceedingly fast, but it really didn't drag for the most part. i spent at least 5 minutes in each class thinking on how close and yet far Wednesday seems...i've waited so long, come so far, and so a few days should be chump change, right? but these are the most antagonizing days since the better part of December. i thought on how much Wednesday is going to be spent before i even get to spend *REAL* time with him. there's school, then i have 45 minutes until back up band, and that runs till around 5. not to mention we'll have to leave around 9 or 930 to take him home, because he's most likely going to his parents' house, which is all the way on the north side of town. at least he made himself a smart decision, though. living at "home" will help him save money if he can get the job he thinks he can, but he also looked at a job in a factory on Hadley Rd. then again, he's also contemplating having the money [from WHO KNOWS WHERE] to get a moped, since you don't need a driver's license to drive them. *sigh* my head is swelling, so it would seem, just a little more and more with each detail and building thought. maybe i think too hard too much, ya think? turned in my research paper on tuesday in the hopes of getting it back by today, so i wouldn't have to wait until monday to work my final draft...but no, all i did was turn it in early...i guess Mrs. Campbell likes me, but not enough to do a little extra work to look over ONE STUDENT'S PAPER a few days early...heaven FORBID someone in her class turn something in on time, LET ALONE early ... *grumbles* last rising thoughts for the time being: though i know how absolutely unlikely it is, it'd be nice if i got just one more letter from Andi before Wednesday...who knows what'll happen.... i just won't know what to do with myself after he gets out, i mean...i don't need to write him anymore, so what will i DO in class? actually listen to the lectures? lol.... i dunno kids, maybe i'll take up Kaia as my therapist again...i haven't written, nor recieved, a note from anyone in a little less than 2 1/2 months... *shruggs* i've been otherwise occupied and distracted. oh yeah, and thinking back on what Artek said once upon a week ago or something, MAYBE i let the whole situation consume my life, but i think i was JUSTIFIED. i didn't appreciate the comment he made, but i did ask him to tell me what he thought, so i can't be too upset....slightly annoyed maybe. "i'm gonna twist out like Mike McGill" [heaven is a halfpipe] -Siella
even if you tell me to get a life and let it go, leave me some love <3 ......please? [1] [2] [3] more to come... and [3] is out of my price range, but i like it so much!

my love, my love is ready for you.

this song really says something to me. something about the cruelty of greedy people, and what they do to generous people. read through the lyrics and see if it speaks to you, too. Listen, children, to a story That was written long ago, 'Bout a kingdom on a mountain And the valley-folk below. On the mountain was a treasure Buried deep beneath the stone, And the valley-people swore They'd have it for their very own. Go ahead and hate your neighbor, Go ahead and cheat a friend. Do it in the name of Heaven, You can justify it in the end. There won't be any trumpets blowing Come the judgement day, On the bloody morning after.... One tin soldier rides away. So the people of the valley Sent a message up the hill, Asking for the buried treasure, Tons of gold for which they'd kill. Came an answer from the kingdom, "With our brothers we will share All the secrets of our mountain, All the riches buried there." Go ahead and hate your neighbor, Go ahead and cheat a friend. Do it in the name of Heaven, You can justify it in the end. There won't be any trumpets blowing Come the judgement day, On the bloody morning after.... One tin soldier rides away. Now the valley cried with anger, "Mount your horses! Draw your sword!" And they killed the mountain-people, So they won their just reward. Now they stood beside the treasure, On the mountain, dark and red. Turned the stone and looked beneath it... "Peace on Earth" was all it said. Go ahead and hate your neighbor, Go ahead and cheat a friend. Do it in the name of Heaven, You can justify it in the end. There won't be any trumpets blowing Come the judgement day, On the bloody morning after.... One tin soldier rides away. Go ahead and hate your neighbor, Go ahead and cheat a friend. Do it in the name of Heaven, You can justify it in the end. There won't be any trumpets blowing Come the judgement day, On the bloody morning after.... One tin soldier rides away.

--forewarning-- ok, i've purged. and this all looks like vomit on page, but you all can plug your nose and wade through it. ---------------
my valentines day didn't get sad, cuz i didn't notice that it was valetine's day, at least not really. i spent most of yesterday playing Xtreme bouncy ball with Cody, hanging around with Liz, Dan, and Zach and making myself completely forget anything hurting or antagonizing. the worst part of yesterday was when Charisma didn't make the night show and Class Royale did. why? because all of the people i wanted to be around would be leaving within the hour. so i followed Zach around like a lost puppy until they all paraded away. then i slipped sadly into the CR room and laid down to take a nap with Ray and Jess. Katie was there too, but i don't really think she sees me as an equal, and i generally don't enjoy being looked down upon. Jess got up to have Brent help her with her hair, then Katie trickled away, and Ray and i just laid there for another 20 minutes until it was time to get ready to perform. then i sulked with one of my 'select' sophomore friends in herds of no more than 3 myself included. we placed 3rd, under Huntington North and Carroll, and we apathetically walked back to the room, packed up and left. i realized yesterday that i have a major problem with a lot of the people i spend a lot of my time around. like more than a few of the Elite girls, half of Class Royale, all but 2 of the band and crew people, almost 3/4 of the people at Homestead. i don't know if i want to call myself selective, deep seeded, or just a picky bitch...i just feel like im not making new friends and being closed minded and hearted. this morning i woke up and was a little disconcerted when i read Kaia's lj and thought i had been left out of the 'key players' sequence...and thus slunk off to sulk for awhile, only to find out it was an html mishap. after checking and reading the 'fixed' entry from Kaia, i started talking to people, and i got to thinking too hard again. i noticed Owen was on, so i cautiously asked him some questions concerning Leigha. i asked if he and Leigha had hung out with Kelly lately, and he said no actually they really hadn't at all. i know Leigha still had some angst and anger towards Kelly, last i'd heard. but she was talking with Kelly again not too long ago, and from what i had read in archives in Kelly's hidden journal, it seemed like Kelly thought she and Leigha were becoming friends again...and i just never hear from her, and when i txt she doesnt answer, and in the back of my head i'm screaming at me "she doesn't care anymore, she's going to be kelly's friend and you'll never have what you had in october, november and december." i'm starting to feel faith-lost in the people i think im friends with. i'm almost constantly apathetic when i talk to Kaia sometimes, especially when he calls, i've lost contact with Owen, so it seems, and i just question everyone i know, except Zach and Jamie, and those two should generally have been my biggest concern as far as friends not really being as strong as i see them as, since they go to different schools than i, and they met me because i was just 'andi's girlfriend.' i know i shouldn't think leigha has or would drop me, since she and i 'hung out' not too long ago, and then she talked to me for awhile last saturday when i was run off the road, but i think maybe i feel like she's like Andi right now; she's on the other end of the phone, the other side of the glass...and theres part of my mind that seems to wonder if they're just figments of my imagination. its almost disconcerting. ------- Owen: for the first i cant imagine how it feels to be without someone you love like how andi isn't there me: he's here. me: he's just not. me: wow that sounds stupid. Owen: i know what you mean and i meant it the same way you did me: he's there on the other side of the glass... me: on the other end of the phone me: the other side of my consciousness Owen: i don't know what i will do when leigha goes to australia this summer for a whole month, and thats only a third of the time that andi has been gone Owen: but i think you let it take your life over ------- while i was talking to Owen, i realized that he's one of them. one of the people that thinks Andi is a bum. a deadbeat. not worth the time i put in. a part of my life i'd be better off without. yeah? well i have news for all of you. that's not happening. don't like it? too bad.

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!! why do i let stupid insignificant people do this to me???? i just got done talking to Mike, and he just....*fists air* ooooo he just makes me mad at how down i just got from talking to him for such a short time. why all this mess? he asked me what i was doing for Valentine's Day, i said i had a show choir competition. he says oh, that sucks. i said hanging around in the company of Zach and Cody is better than sitting at home alone sulking about how my idiot is in jail, right? he says, aw its not so bad...maybe he'll send you a heart carved out of the soap he didn't drop lol. no, not funny there Mikey, thanks for reminding my that you have a new whore and i'm living on the hopes that the next 20 days will melt away... so i meant for my last entry to be long and recap my weekend with Tara at Ball State, but i don't have the will to retype all that i lost, as it was almost 3 pages... Reader's Digest: -some idiot put a crack in my windshield, and it needs replaced now -some idiont on I-69 almost killed me trying to do 85 on ice, mom had to pull me out of the snow on the median, and i was late getting to BSU, so i had to sit in the Media Center or awhile instead of sleeping -went rollerskating with Kappa Delta, became camera bitch being the only person WITH the group but not IN the group -Tara and i went to Muncie Mall, wandered and then saw Paycheck. go see it. NOW. -we crashed early, got up later than we had planned and i had a healthy breakfast of a muffin, some of Tara's chocolate milk and some cookies'n'cream moose. -got home around 345, Zoe and i left to go harass Jamie and Bastian around 450, dropped back home around 6, fed the dogs, and Jamie i headed to Huntington to visit Andi -surprised Andi being there this week, shared visits with his grandma, too -took Jamie home, realized i'd driven 125 miles since i filled up when i first got back to Fort Wayne, came home, called it a night. yesterday i had some stuff to turn in in English, did that...today i had 2 tests in 2nd and 3rd periods, trig chapter 6 and government. weeee i had a headache since i woke up, so i made myself suffer through my tests then surrended to the clinic at the beginning of 4th. came home, slept for awhile, sat awake for another while, and i have a choir concert i have to be at in an hour. in the mail today i got information from 3 colleges, Carthage, Goshen, and Capital. Carthage was sacked, being a private school. Goshen didn't give me much information, so i filled out the little slip to have them send me some more info. Capital interested me....and i'm not sure why. i actually read the entire thing they sent, and want to send the card back for a little more information. and reading the letter that came with Carthage, i realized i need to sign up for SATs and ACTs still.... so i got online, meaning to do so, and instead i got on lj. go figure. but Xaeli had posted something about SATs and ACTs and so i found my way to college board. i can't sign up until they post a new date. i'll check again after the 20th, when the sign up for the March 27th testing is closed. woo hoo. *cheers* -Siella

alright, this one of potentially several. i've come to realize that i haven't updated in FOREVER and made a worthwhile entry. first, my apologies, but a week ago i wasn't sure if i would ever punch livejournal into my URL bar ever again, sooooooo....yeah, then i kinda got stupified by Tobi-intercention...and of course, in my efforts to keep up with writing to him daily, i've neglected to fill all of you in on my day-to-day events and on-goings.....hmmm, ok, anyway...so on with it already, right? back tracking, my visit with Andi. I was there on time, and annoyed that Spike's car wasn't in front of the apartments [meaning he isn't there, and i can't bust in and annoy him...damn.] but i sat calmly, signed in with the officer when she came out, and she said "you're in the 730 visits tonight." i said "ok" and took my seat. completely without thinking, i stood up when the door unlocked and filed into the sardine tank [mini room in between the lobby and the visitation room] with 6 or 7 other people....weeeeeeeeeeeeell when i got in, i didn't get an Andi, so i came to realize that i was in the 7-730 visitation.....SOOOOOO i got to sit in the boiling room [the visitation room is ALWAYS like, 15 degrees warmer than the lobby, so you really think you ARE boiling] for an half hour with nothing to do but stew about my own stupidity. the lady in the control room looked at me funny when i walked into the sardine tank, out to the lobby, then back into the tank again....but she didn't try to stop me, so....i guess no matter. then visits progressed as usual, so it was wonderous....though there was a screaming child in there this time, and it sounded like someone was beating the kid against the glass....don't ask me, thats just what it sounded like...craziness....whatever they were doing to taht kid, it was hurting my head and driving me up the wall. my life as told via lj, to be continued. *cheers* -Siella
